instruction: Can laboratory imaging visible-near-infrared (VNIR) spectroscopy be considered a superior method for investigating the molecular changes of particulate organic matter (POM) during decomposition at a sub-millimeter scale compared to traditional methods?
Output: Yes, laboratory imaging visible-near-infrared (VNIR) spectroscopy can be considered a superior method for investigating the molecular changes of particulate organic matter (POM) during decomposition at a sub-millimeter scale compared to traditional methods. This is because VNIR spectroscopy allows for direct measurements of POM elemental and molecular composition, providing high-resolution mapping of the spatial distribution of the molecular characteristics of organic particles in soil cores.
